title: large synced files deleted permanently (data loss)
body:
it appears that error handling in the webdav/csync implementation isn't well implemented.

added a relatively large file (65 mb) to a synced directory. uploading it exceeds my fcgi max request length.
after some syncing the client reported that the sync was successful but the file wasn't accessible in the web interface. no error message or anything informing the user. this is not nice but not critical too.

but: after some more syncs of other files the new 65 mb file has been deleted from the local directory and still wasn't available online too!! as it wasn't only at any time there is no history available.

happily i've had a (older) backup of my files and was able to restore an older version of it to try it again. but same thing happened again.

that's why i tried uploading the file via web interface and tracked the http response via firebug as the web interface didn't reported any error too. this way i realized the error 500 and found the "max request length exceeded" error in the webservers logs.

i would really like to use owncloud but data loss is a no-go - if there are any http errors which is a very common case there should be an error message for the user and no data loss - if the client is unsure weather a file should be deleted it should rename it, move it to an recycle bin/review directory or anything else but not deleted it without any possibility to recover it.

i'm using owncloud 4.5.1 with windows client 1.1.1
